"Les Valseuses" was originally a novel that French film-maker Blier adapted to the screen, and as expected he adored this story with one monologue in particular being so seamless that you can easily read the words without blinking an eye.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat-loving elderly neighbor, Lucy Caroline Chandler (Katherine Forsdyke). When it seems that Lucy will either lose the farmhouse or sell it to this couple, she hires an elderly man with strange powers to acquire it for her at any cost.
